active_learning.discussion_prompt: Discuss the trade-offs of SDN's centralization: How does it enhance cybersecurity automation (e.g., dynamic policy enforcement) while introducing risks like single-point-of-failure attacks on the controller? Provide examples from real-world breaches.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Software-Defined Networking (SDN) Design (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Information System Lifecycle > Architecture and Design > Network Architecture Design > SDN Design). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning components, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to create 50 high-quality flashcards. Incorporate: - Voter consensus: Complete design principles/best practices (TLS for APIs/OpenFlow, controller segmentation/redundancy, anomaly detection). Link to prior knowledge (OSI model, traditional networks). - Research context: Control/data planes, SDN controller, NBAPIs/SBAPIs (e.g., OpenFlow), attack surfaces (examtopics.com). - Pedagogy: Objectives span Bloom's (remember/understand/apply/analyze/evaluate/create). Embed active learning ties. Output ONLY valid JSON array of flashcards, each as: {"front": "Question text", "back": {"answer": "...", "explanation": "... (include Bloom's level, layer, distractor rationale if MCQ, source)", "active_learning_tie_in": "..."}}. Ensure completeness, scaffolding progression (Layer 1 foundation to Layer 4 integration), distractors per protocol, and cybersecurity focus (secure SDN design).
